description: SRD Data: Compile 5e SRD items from Open5e API into structured JSON databases

userStories.title: Weapons database
userStories.description: As a user, I want standard 5e weapons available for quick lookup when adding items to my inventory.
acceptanceCriteria: Create backend/app/data/ directory if it doesn't exist
Create backend/app/data/weapons.json
Fetch weapon data from Open5e API (https://api.open5e.com/v1/weapons/) or use SRD reference
Include all simple melee weapons: club, dagger, greatclub, handaxe, javelin, light hammer, mace, quarterstaff, sickle, spear
Include all simple ranged weapons: light crossbow, dart, shortbow, sling
Include all martial melee weapons: battleaxe, flail, glaive, greataxe, greatsword, halberd, lance, longsword, maul, morningstar, pike, rapier, scimitar, shortsword, trident, war pick, warhammer, whip
Include all martial ranged weapons: blowgun, hand crossbow, heavy crossbow, longbow, net

Each weapon object has: id (kebab-case), name, type ('equipment'), category ('weapon'), subcategory ('simple melee'|'simple ranged'|'martial melee'|'martial ranged'), damage_dice, damage_type, weight (number in lbs), value_gp (number), properties (array of strings like 'finesse', 'versatile', 'thrown', etc.)
For versatile weapons, include versatile_dice field
For thrown/ranged weapons, include range field as string '20/60' format
JSON is valid (parseable by jq)
JSON is formatted with 2-space indentation
userStories.notes: Source: https://api.open5e.com/v1/weapons/ or PHB SRD. Ensure all values match official SRD.

userStories.title: Armor database
userStories.description: As a user, I want standard 5e armor available for quick lookup when adding items to my inventory.
acceptanceCriteria: Create backend/app/data/armor.json
Include light armor: padded (AC 11), leather (AC 11), studded leather (AC 12)
Include medium armor: hide (AC 12), chain shirt (AC 13), scale mail (AC 14), breastplate (AC 14), half plate (AC 15)
Include heavy armor: ring mail (AC 14), chain mail (AC 16), splint (AC 17), plate (AC 18)
Include shield (AC +2)

Each armor object has: id (kebab-case), name, type ('equipment'), category ('armor'), armor_type ('light'|'medium'|'heavy'|'shield'), ac_base (number), ac_max_dex_bonus (number or null for no limit), stealth_disadvantage (boolean), strength_requirement (number or null), weight (number in lbs), value_gp (number)
For shields: ac_bonus field instead of ac_base
JSON is valid and formatted with 2-space indentation

userStories.title: Potions database
userStories.description: As a user, I want standard 5e potions available with their effects pre-filled.
acceptanceCriteria: Create backend/app/data/potions.json

Include all healing potions: Potion of Healing (2d4+2, common, 50gp), Potion of Greater Healing (4d4+4, uncommon, 150gp), Potion of Superior Healing (8d4+8, rare, 500gp), Potion of Supreme Healing (10d4+20, very rare, 1350gp)

Include common/uncommon potions: Potion of Climbing, Potion of Fire Breath, Potion of Growth, Potion of Heroism, Potion of Invisibility, Potion of Mind Reading, Potion of Poison, Potion of Resistance, Potion of Speed, Potion of Water Breathing
Include Giant Strength potions: Hill (STR 21), Frost/Stone (STR 23), Fire (STR 25), Cloud (STR 27), Storm (STR 29)
Include Potion of Flying
Each potion object has: id (kebab-case), name, type ('potion'), rarity ('common'|'uncommon'|'rare'|'very_rare'|'legendary'), effect_description (string describing effect), value_gp (number)
For healing potions: add healing_dice field (e.g., '2d4+2')
For buff potions: add duration field (e.g., '1 hour', '10 minutes')
For potions that set stats: add stat_bonus object (e.g., {"stat": "strength", "value": 21})
JSON is valid and formatted with 2-space indentation
userStories.notes: Values from DMG. Prices are approximate market values.

userStories.title: Adventuring gear database
userStories.description: As a user, I want common adventuring gear available for quick addition to my inventory.
acceptanceCriteria: Create backend/app/data/gear.json

Include essential adventuring gear: backpack, bedroll, blanket, candle, chain (10 ft), chalk, climber's kit, clothes (common/fine/traveler's), component pouch, crowbar, flask, grappling hook, hammer, healer's kit, holy symbol, hourglass, hunting trap, ink, ink pen, ladder, lamp, lantern (bullseye/hooded), lock, magnifying glass, manacles, map/scroll case, mess kit, mirror, oil, paper, parchment, perfume, pick (miner's), piton, pole (10 ft), pot (iron), pouch, quiver, rations, rope (hemp/silk), sack, scale (merchant's), sealing wax, shovel, signal whistle, signet ring, soap, spellbook, spikes (iron), spyglass, tent, thieves' tools, tinderbox, torch, vial, waterskin, whetstone

Each item has: id (kebab-case), name, type ('gear'), category (string like 'container', 'tool', 'supply', 'clothing'), description (brief string), weight (number in lbs, can be 0), value_gp (number, can be decimal like 0.5)
Include at least 30 common items
JSON is valid and formatted with 2-space indentation
userStories.notes: Focus on commonly used items. Can expand later.

userStories.title: Combined SRD index
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a combined index of all items for quick search/autocomplete.
acceptanceCriteria: Create backend/app/data/srd_index.json
Load all items from weapons.json, armor.json, potions.json, gear.json
Create combined array of all items
Each index entry has: id, name, type, category, source_file (e.g., 'weapons.json')
Sort array alphabetically by name
Add metadata object at top level with total_count and last_updated (ISO date string)
Structure: { "metadata": { "total_count": N, "last_updated": "2026-01-31" }, "items": [...] }
JSON is valid and formatted with 2-space indentation
userStories.notes: This index enables fast autocomplete without loading full item data.
